title: Pesa Twist
text:
Pesa Twist is a articulated low floor <a href="tram">tram</a> produced in <a href="Bydgoszcz">Bydgoszcz</a> by <a href="Pesa%20SA">Pesa SA</a>. The Twist is currently operated in <a href="Cz%C4%99stochowa">Częstochowa</a>, <a href="G%C3%B3rno%C5%9Bl%C4%85ski%20Okr%C4%99g%20Przemys%C5%82owy">Górnośląski Okręg Przemysłowy</a>, <a href="Moscow">Moscow</a>, <a href="Kyiv">Kyiv</a>, <a href="Krak%C3%B3w">Kraków</a> and <a href="Wroc%C5%82aw">Wrocław</a>.
History.
Pesa Bydgoszcz started production of trams in 2006. The first model produced was the Tramicus (2006-2008), and since 2010, the Swing.. Their structures, however, were close to each other (30-meter trams have about 5 sections moving on six wheels).
At that time, <a href="MPK%20Cz%C4%99stochowa">MPK Częstochowa</a> issued a tender for the purchase of brand-new low-floor trams because of the planned opening of a new tram line have increased need for rolling stock. In 2012 <a href="Silesian%20Interurbans">Silesian Interurbans</a> bought 30 Pesa twist-step trams, and a year later Moscow bought 120 Pesa Fokstrot units (based on Twist-Step). In the following year, <a href="MPK%20Krak%C3%B3w">MPK Kraków</a> bought 36 trams, and in 2015 MPK Wrocław also bought Pesa Twist trams.
